results.title: A Long shot that paid off: CSIRO's atomic aborption project
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The discovery in the early 19th century that chemical elements could be identified by observing their emission spectra lead to the development of accurate methods of chemical analysis based on atomic emission spectra. But it was nearly 100 years before Dr A. Walsh of the CSIRO Division of Chemical Physics started asking questions and became convinced that there would be many fundamental advantages in using spectrochemical methods based on atomic absorption spectra. Despite many technical difficulties and lack of interest overseas, Dr Walsh and his colleagues persisted and finally showed that the technique they had devised, had widespread applications in fields as diverse as medicine, engineering, agriculture and mineral exploration. Cinematography: Peter Bruce

results.title: A Long night with lethal guests
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Deals with malaria in New Guinea and research to find a cure. The film travels with a medical anthropologist to the rain-forest clad Schrader mountains where the Hagahai people live. The Hagahai people are being treated for malaria and other related infections transmitted through contact with the malaria-rife coast due to new road and air links. Researchers are looking at the way immunity to malaria works while treating people like the Hagahai.

results.title: A Long hour's walk
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Father Rene Garcia walks through the outskirts of Bogota and discusses the poverty of both urban and rural Colombian working class. In the face of poverty, hunger, illness and premature death, can there still be hope?

results.title: A Lonely woman = Kobieta Samotna [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Telewizja Polska S A and Zespol Filmowy "X"
results.brief_description: Banned in Poland due to its candid representation of the bleakness of life under socialism, “A Lonely Woman” is one of Holland’s most powerful films and her last prior to her exile in France. Irena is a lonely middle-aged women and single mother living in poverty in a small Polish town. Deprived of help and friendship, she has little contact with anyone apart from her son on whom she dotes. One day while on her mail round, she meets a crippled young miner named Jacek and a love affair gradually develops between the couple based on their mutual loneliness. Irena’s circumstances become even more dire when the sick relative she has been caring for dies and she is faced with the funeral costs rather than the inheritance she expected. In desperation she steals the pensioners’ money that she is supposed to deliver, puts her son in a boarding school, buys a car and heads to West Berlin with Jacek. Yet in a surprise plot twist the couple’s getaway takes an alarming turn. Cast includes Maria Chwalibog, and Boguslaw Linda. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: A Loaf of bread
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the whole process for the production of bread, beginning with the planting and harvesting of wheat and the milling of flour. After scenes showing the preparation of the dough, animated drawings show how the bread is carried through the oven on an endless belt, coming out baked and ready for delivery.

results.title: A Little summermusik
results.creator_credit: Bill Davies and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film pastorale set in the early summer near Elora, Ontario where music students practice out-of-doors. Lush green fields, towering elms and a rippling stream near an old farmhouse provide a rich setting for young musicians playing solo or together on flutes, strings, piano. Music has charm indeed when the mood is of lilac and the sweet pipings of spring.

results.title: A Little princess
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Cuaron, Mark Johnson and Baltimore Pictures
results.brief_description: From the beloved classic novel by the author of “The Secret garden” comes a wondrous film, filled with storytelling magic that unlocks imagination and inspires dreams. It is the story of Sara Crewe, a young girl who shares an exotic life with her devoted father in India until he is called to military service and Sara is sent to a strict New York boarding school. Sara’s natural exuberance is misunderstood and she gains an undeserved reputation as a troublemaker. She draws strength from knowing that to her father she will always be a little Princess. With courage, imagination and kindness, she overcomes the hardships that beset her and changes both her life and the fortunes of those around her. Cast includes Eleanor Bron, Liam Cunningham, Liesel Matthews, Rusty Schwimmer, Arthur Malet, Alison Moir.

results.title: A Little phantasy on a 19th century painting (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Isle of the Dead, by the 19th Century painter Arnold Boecklin, is the subject of this McLaren experimental film. The spectral island wakes to mysterious life, flickers in candlelight and fades again into the dark - the whole effect heightened by an interpretive musical score. Music, Louis Applebaum. (Award: Salerno.)

results.title: A Little night music
results.creator_credit: Harold Prince, Elliott Kastner, S&T-Film Berlin and Sascha Wein Film
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy musical adapted from the Broadway stage play by Harold Prince and Stephen Sondheim, set in Vienna at the turn of the century. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Diana Rigg, Len Cariou, Lesley-Ann Down, Hermione Gingold, Laurence Guittard. Features the well-known song “Send in the Clowns”. Screenplay by Hugh Wheeler.

results.title: A Little memory
results.creator_credit: Truyen Dinh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Truyen Dinh Le, a refugee himself from Vietnam, tells a harrowing story of courage and determination by his father-in-law to find peace and a better life for his family, away from the war in Vietnam to the safe haven of Australian shores.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Truyen Dinh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
